title: Judd Trump tells Ronnie O’Sullivan to stop moaning as English Open criticism continues
text:
Judd Trump is not impressed with Ronnie O’Sullivan’s comments (Picture: Getty Images)

Judd Trump is not impressed with Ronnie O’Sullivan’s criticism of the English Open in Crawley and suggests the Rocket should stop moaning.

O’Sullivan blasted the K2 Leisure Centre last year as a ‘hellhole’ that ‘smelled of urine’ and he doubled down on his criticism on Monday as he returned to the venue, saying, ‘every day in Crawley is a day lost in my life.’

The top two players in the world have differing views on the home of the English Open, with world champion Trump looking on the bright side, while O’Sullivan suggested that the only redeeming feature of Crawley is ‘the M23 out of here.’

Both men won their first round matches at the English Open on Monday, and when Trump was questioned about Ronnie’s criticism of the venue, he was not ready to give it any credence.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Did he enter it this year? Well that says it all doesn’t it,’ said the world champion, dismissively.

‘The first time you go somewhere you never know, but if you’re entering the tournament a second time you can’t pick faults after you play for the second time.

‘I want to play in every event that I can, last year was a bit disappointing here, it wasn’t quite up to scratch, but they’ve made a few changes.

‘Anyone that’s entered it this year can’t really moan about conditions, they knew what they were like last year.’

There have been some logistical changes to the venue since last year, with the practice room being moved, but the Rocket remains unconvinced by the West Sussex leisure centre.

‘It hasn’t changed as far as I’m concerned,’ said the five-time world champion. ‘You’d have to do a lot to change this place, wouldn’t you? You’d have to do an overall refurb on this place, but I’m not surprised, it is what I expected it to be.’

Trump hammered O’Sullivan 10-4 in the Masters final (Picture: Getty Images)

Trump and O’Sullivan have not met on the table yet this season, but many snooker fans will be hoping they come through their parts of the draw in Crawley to set up a huge semi-final this week.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The pair played three classic matches last season, with Trump winning in the finals of the Northern Ireland Open and Masters, before O’Sullivan gained a measure of revenge by edging the Bristolian 10-9 in the Tour Championship semi-finals.

Trump will face Sam Baird or Daniel Wells in the second round this week, with the Rocket taking on Yuan Sijun or Igor Figueiredo.

description: Judd Trump is not impressed with Ronnie O'Sullivan's criticism of the English Open in Crawley and suggests the Rocket should stop moaning. O'Sullivan blasted the K2 Leisure Centre last year...
